result.execSummary:
The defendant Fredrick J Crawford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW hearing February 26, 2015 at 1:30, BR. 40.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as ordered.  No DNA surcharge as no sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or attend school.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with Levelle B., Norman B., and Anthony S. unless they request contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
No violent contact with Bernice B. rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete anger management counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determ ined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Fredrick J Crawford in court PRO SE.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Fredrick J Crawford in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is mostly compliant with probation.  The court STAYED 2 days condition time.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 673
cf
Counts three and four.
Count two.

Defendant Fredrick J Crawford in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Bernice B.  
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 4:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with Levelle B., Norman B. and Anthony S. UNLESS they requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with Bernice B. rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  No DNA surcharge as no sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment and/or attend school.
-No firearms; weapons.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 227 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 227  days time served.  

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Bernice C B  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26214217 in court 2x on  10/12/15, 10/13/2015.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Levell D B  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26214216  in court 2x on  10/12/15, 10/13/2015.

Defendant Fredrick J Crawford in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Defendant Fredrick J Crawford in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS  2,3 AND 4: OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
